page.title: 07MAB'S CROSS
page.content:
Our school is called{Mab's Cross}and it got its name from Lady Mabel Bradshaigh who lived at{Haigh Hall. Lady Mabel's husband had to go fight in a crusade. After ten years he had not come back so Lady Mabel married again, this time to Welsh knight. Her first husband returned and found out. He killed the knight and as a severe punishment for his wife he made her walk barefoot all the way from Haigh Hall past the area where our school is now to a{stone cross}and back to Haigh Hall, about four miles in all.
Today Haigh Hall has been made into a{country park}and some{nature trails and Mab's Cross is situated right in front of our school.
